alert.note: Alert for Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 5:32PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Chatham. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 526 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, primarily between Savannah and Port Wentworth. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen over the central portion of Chatham County. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area by 7 PM. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. High tide will occur around 7 PM, likely resulting in slow draining of storm water. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Hunter Army Airfield, Downtown Savannah, Windsor Forest, Midtown Savannah, Coffee Bluff, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Savannah International Airport, Montgomery, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Thunderbolt, Vernonburg, White Bluff, Savannah Historic District, Sandfly, Isle Of Hope, Whitemarsh Island and Skidaway Island.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
